intro: Brahea brandegeei, commonly known as the Brandegee's pittosporum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Pittosporaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern California and northern Baja California, where it thrives in sandy, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage, which consists of long, narrow, leathery leaves that are dark green in color. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Brahea brandegeei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to coastal environments.
